recordTypes.name: Welding/Cutting Permit
recordTypes.description: All hot work in the Town of Needham requires a permit. In accordance with the Fire Code, plumbers and gas fitters do not need an additional hot work permit, but may require a detail. Hot work is defined as any activity that involves heat, spark, or flame that is capable of starting fires or explosions. Examples include, but are not limited to, welding, cutting, grinding, soldering, heat treating, hot riveting, torch applied roofing, abrasive blasting, and powder driven fasteners. When applying for a hot work permit, please ensure all operators working under the permit have completed the NFPA Hot Work Safety program or an equivalent found at the Massachusetts DFS website. Copies of all operatorsâ€™ certificates are to be attached to the submittal. In addition, please attach a letter from the building owner giving permission to perform hot work at the location. Most hot work will require a fire detail.  Please note we require a minimum of 48 hours notice to secure a detail.  There is a 4 hour minimum for all details.  The fee is $55 an hour plus a 10% administrative fee.

recordTypes.name: Dumpster Permit
recordTypes.description:
Permits must be acquired by March 31st starting this year and must be renewed by this date in future years to stay in compliance with Article 8. 

We recommend that the applicant who creates an account on this permitting website provides a general purpose email that is unlikely to change, is monitored frequently and is accessible by the applicant and any other personnel responsible for permitting perpetually into the future. This will ensure that you receive consistent receipt of renewal reminders, communications and notifications even if personnel changes and reduces the chances of you being fined for allowing this permit to lapse. 

If you are unsure if you particular waste hauler is permitted with our office and/or do not know the permit number, you may contact our office for the current list of haulers along with their permit #'s or you can find a list of haulers permitted as of May 15, 2025 on our website: https://www.needhamma.gov/5645/Licensed-septic-installers-and-waste-hau.
